plugin.name: RHQAgent
plugin.description: Management and monitoring of the RHQ Agent

c:list-property.name: logEventSources
c:list-property.description: The list of log files that can be tracked

c:simple-property.name: logFilePath
c:simple-property.description: The absolute path to the source log file.

c:simple-property.name: enabled
c:simple-property.description: A flag indicating whether or not this log source is currently enabled (i.e. whether the associated log file should be tailed for new entries).

c:simple-property.name: dateFormat
c:simple-property.description: The date format to use when parsing the dates in log entries. The format must be in the syntax defined by the Java SimpleDateFormat class. If not specified, the three date formats that are predefined by Log4J (ISO8601, DATE, and ABSOLUTE) will be tried.

c:simple-property.name: includesPattern
c:simple-property.description: A regular expression against which a log entry's detail is matched to determine if an event should be fired for that entry. If not specified, no filtering of log entries will be done based on their detail.

c:simple-property.name: minimumSeverity
c:simple-property.description: The minimum severity of log messages that should be collected for this source. If not specified, there is no minimum severity (i.e. all log messages will be collected).

c:simple-property.name: snapshotConfigEnabled
c:simple-property.description: If true, take a snapshot of the configuration

c:simple-property.name: snapshotLogEnabled
c:simple-property.description: If true, take a snapshot of the log files

c:simple-property.name: snapshotDataEnabled
c:simple-property.description: If true, take a snapshot of the data files

c:simple-property.name: childJmxServerName
c:simple-property.description: The name of the child JVM resource.

operation.name: restart
operation.description: Shuts down the agent's comm layer and plugin container and starts them up again. This does *not* restart the agent's VM - use the launcher services to do that.

operation.name: shutdown
operation.description: Shuts down the agent's comm layer and plugin container. If the agent is in daemon mode, the entire agent VM will exit

operation.name: restartPluginContainer
operation.description: Recycles the plugin container.

operation.name: downloadLatestFailoverList
operation.description: Tells the agent to download an updated server failover list. This will also check to make sure the agent is pointing to its primary server as found in the new failover list and, if not, will attempt to switch to the primary server now.

operation.name: updatePlugins
operation.description: Tells the agent to update its plugins. This pulls new/updated plugins down from the RHQ Server

operation.name: retrieveAllPluginInfo
operation.description: Retrieves information on all deployed plugins.

c:simple-property.name: name
c:simple-property.description: Name of the plugin

c:simple-property.name: path
c:simple-property.description: Full path to the plugin as seen by the agent

c:simple-property.name: timestamp
c:simple-property.description: Last time the plugin was updated

c:simple-property.name: size
c:simple-property.description: Size of the plugin file

c:simple-property.name: md5
c:simple-property.description: MD5 of the plugin file

operation.name: retrievePluginInfo
operation.description: Retrieves information on a specific plugin.

c:simple-property.name: pluginName
c:simple-property.description: The name of the plugin whose info is to be retrieved

c:simple-property.name: name
c:simple-property.description: Name of the plugin

c:simple-property.name: path
c:simple-property.description: Full path to the plugin as seen by the agent

c:simple-property.name: timestamp
c:simple-property.description: Last time the plugin was updated

c:simple-property.name: size
c:simple-property.description: Size of the plugin file

c:simple-property.name: md5
c:simple-property.description: MD5 of the plugin file

operation.name: executeAvailabilityScan
operation.description: Runs an availability scan and returns a report of its findings. An availability report tells you what resources are up or down. This operation will send the report to the server for processing, as well as return the results.

c:simple-property.name: changesOnly
c:simple-property.description: If true, this reports only those availabililities that have changed

c:simple-property.name: agentName
c:simple-property.description: The name of the agent that produced the report

c:simple-property.name: isChangesOnly
c:simple-property.description: If true, only resources that have changed availability will be in the report

c:simple-property.name: resourceId
c:simple-property.description: The unique ID of the resource whose availability is being reported

c:simple-property.name: resourceName
c:simple-property.description: The name of the resource whose availability is being reported

c:simple-property.name: isAvailable
c:simple-property.description: If true, the resource is UP, otherwise it is considered DOWN

operation.name: retrieveCurrentDateTime
operation.description: Obtains the agent's current date/time.

c:simple-property.name: timeZone
c:simple-property.description: A timezone identifier that will be used to format the date/time string. This can be either an abbreviation such as 'PST', a full name such as 'America/Los_Angeles', or a custom ID such as 'GMT-8:00'. If this is not specified, the agent's local time zone will be used. If the given time zone identifier is unknown, 'GMT' will be the default.

c:simple-property.name: dateTime
c:simple-property.description: The agent's current date/time, formatted in the given time zone

operation.name: setDebugMode
operation.description: Turns on or off debug mode, which causes the agent to emit verbose log messages.

c:simple-property.name: enabled
c:simple-property.description: Indicates if debug mode should be enabled or disabled

c:simple-property.name: traceMessaging
c:simple-property.description: Indicates if incoming and outgoing messages should be traced. This tracks the messaging between the agent and its server. This will be ignored and default to false if 'enabled' is false.

operation.name: executePromptCommand
operation.description: Executes an agent prompt command, just as if you invoked the command at the agent prompt in a console. Note that you must ensure the prompt command does not require additional input, since the agent will look for that input from another source (e.g. console keyboard).

c:simple-property.name: command
c:simple-property.description: The prompt command to execute

c:simple-property.name: output
c:simple-property.description: The results of the prompt command. This will typically be the output that you would have seen in the console, had this prompt command been executed directly on the agent console.

c:simple-property.name: error
c:simple-property.description: If the prompt command execution had an error, this will be information on the error.

operation.name: switchToServer
operation.description: Tell the agent to immediately switch to another server. The given server can be a simple hostname in which case, the current transport, port and transport parameters being used to talk to the current server will stay the same. Otherwise, it will be assumed the server is a full endpoint URL.

c:simple-property.name: server
c:simple-property.description: A simple hostname or a full endpoint URL

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.name
c:simple-property.description: The name that this agent is known as. This is read-only - once assigned, it cannot change.

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.plugins.directory
c:simple-property.description: Location on the file system where the plugin jar files are stored

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.plugins.server-discovery.initial-delay-secs
c:simple-property.description: Startup delay before the first server discovery is run (in seconds)

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.plugins.server-discovery.period-secs
c:simple-property.description: Time between server discoveries (in seconds)

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.plugins.service-discovery.initial-delay-secs
c:simple-property.description: Startup delay before the first service discovery is run (in seconds)

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.plugins.service-discovery.period-secs
c:simple-property.description: Time between service discoveries (in seconds)

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.plugins.availability-scan.initial-delay-secs
c:simple-property.description: Startup delay before the first availability scan is run (in seconds)

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.plugins.availability-scan.period-secs
c:simple-property.description: Time between availability scans (in seconds)

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.plugins.availability-scan.threadpool-size
c:simple-property.description: Number of concurrent threads that scan for resource availabilities

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.plugins.measurement-collection.initial-delay-secs
c:simple-property.description: Startup delay before the first measurement collection is run (in seconds)

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.plugins.measurement-collection.threadpool-size
c:simple-property.description: Number of concurrent measurement collections that can be run

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.plugins.drift-detection.initial-delay-secs
c:simple-property.description: Startup delay before the first drift detection scan is run (in seconds)

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.plugins.drift-detection.period-secs
c:simple-property.description: Time between drift detection scans (in seconds)

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.plugins.operation-invocation-timeout-secs
c:simple-property.description: Time before an operation invocation is aborted (in seconds)

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.plugins.operation-invoker.threadpool-size
c:simple-property.description: Number of concurrent operation invocations that can be run

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.plugins.content-discovery.initial-delay-secs
c:simple-property.description: Startup delay before the first content discovery is run (in seconds)

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.plugins.content-discovery.period-secs
c:simple-property.description: Time between content discoveries (in seconds)

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.plugins.content-discovery.threadpool-size
c:simple-property.description: Number of concurrent content discoveries that can be run

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.plugins.configuration-discovery.initial-delay-secs
c:simple-property.description: Time before configuration change detection starts (in seconds)

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.plugins.configuration-discovery.period-secs
c:simple-property.description: Time period for checking for configuration changes (in seconds)

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.plugins.event-sender.initial-delay-secs
c:simple-property.description: Defines the delay before the first event report gets sent to the server (in seconds)

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.plugins.event-sender.period-secs
c:simple-property.description: Defines how often event reports get sent to the server (in seconds)

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.plugins.event-report.max-per-source
c:simple-property.description: Defines the maximum number of events for any given event source that can be placed in a single event report that is sent up to the server. If this number is larger than the max-total setting, then this setting is ignored

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.plugins.event-report.max-total
c:simple-property.description: Defines the total maximum number of events that can be placed in a single event report that is sent up to the server

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.plugins.disabled
c:simple-property.description: Defines the plugins that should be disabled and not loaded by the plugin container. This is a comma-separated list of plugin names.

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.plugins.disabled-resource-types
c:simple-property.description: Defines the resource types that should be disabled and not used by the plugin container. This is a |-separated list of type names in the form of 'plugin name>parent type>child type'.

c:group.name: comm-endpoints
c:group.c:description: Communication settings that define the endpoints of this RHQ Agent and its RHQ Server

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.server.transport
c:simple-property.description: The transport protocol used to send commands to the RHQ Server. If you want secure communications, the RHQ Server must use an SSL-enabled transport

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.server.bind-address
c:simple-property.description: The RHQ Server address that it is bound to

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.server.bind-port
c:simple-property.description: The port that the RHQ Server is listening to

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.server.transport-params
c:simple-property.description: Custom set of transport parameters used when sending commands to the RHQ Server. Please see the documentation for more information on transport params.

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.server.alias
c:simple-property.description: If the RHQ Server IP address is not defined, this is the DNS alias name that will be looked up to determine the RHQ Server IP address.

c:simple-property.name: rhq.communications.connector.transport
c:simple-property.description: The transport protocol used to receive commands from the RHQ Server. e.g. socket, sslsocket. If you want secure communications, you must use an SSL-enabled transport

c:simple-property.name: rhq.communications.connector.bind-address
c:simple-property.description: The address the agent binds to when listening for incoming commands from the RHQ Server

c:simple-property.name: rhq.communications.connector.bind-port
c:simple-property.description: The port the agent listens to for incoming commands from the RHQ Server

c:simple-property.name: rhq.communications.connector.transport-params
c:simple-property.description: Custom set of transport parameters. Please see the documentation for more information on transport params.

c:group.name: comm-security
c:group.c:description: Settings that secure the communications between the RHQ Agent and RHQ Server

c:simple-property.name: rhq.communications.connector.security.client-auth-mode
c:simple-property.description: Determines if the agent should authenticate a RHQ Server before accepting incoming commands from it

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.client.security.server-auth-mode-enabled
c:simple-property.description: If true, then the agent must authenticate the RHQ Server before it can send it messages

c:group.name: auto-detection
c:group.c:description: Configures auto-detection mechanisms that allow the RHQ Agent to find the RHQ Server and vice versa

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.client.server-polling-interval-msecs
c:simple-property.description: If this value is larger than 0, it indicates the agent should periodically poll the RHQ Server to make sure it's still up or (if it was down) see when it comes back up. The value is the number of milliseconds to wait in between polls

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.server-auto-detection
c:simple-property.description: If true, the agent will use multicast detection to auto-detect the RHQ Server. If this is enabled, make sure you enable and configure the multicast detector

c:simple-property.name: rhq.communications.multicast-detector.enabled
c:simple-property.description: The multicast detector must be enabled if you want the RHQ Agent to auto-detect the RHQ Server and vice versa. Disable this if your network does not support multicast traffic.

c:simple-property.name: rhq.communications.multicast-detector.multicast-address
c:simple-property.description: The address used by JBoss ON to broadcast detection messages. All RHQ Servers and RHQ Agents must be using the same address.

c:simple-property.name: rhq.communications.multicast-detector.bind-address
c:simple-property.description: The address bound by the network interface

c:simple-property.name: rhq.communications.multicast-detector.port
c:simple-property.description: The port that the detector is multicasting to

c:simple-property.name: rhq.communications.multicast-detector.heartbeat-time-delay
c:simple-property.description: The number of milliseconds between heartbeat messages emitted by the multicast detector. This value must be less than the default time delay.

c:simple-property.name: rhq.communications.multicast-detector.default-time-delay
c:simple-property.description: Amount of milliseconds that must pass without hearing a RHQ Server's heartbeat before assuming its down. This value must be greater than the heartbeat time delay.

c:group.name: sender
c:group.c:description: Configures the client sender which is responsible for sending messages to the RHQ Server

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.client.queue-size
c:simple-property.description: Maximum number of commands that the agent can queue up for sending to the RHQ Server. Setting this to 0 makes the queue unbounded.

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.client.max-concurrent
c:simple-property.description: Maximum number of commands that the agent can send to the RHQ Server at the same time.

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.client.command-timeout-msecs
c:simple-property.description: The default time in milliseconds the agent will wait before aborting a command being sent

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.client.retry-interval-msecs
c:simple-property.description: This is the minimum amount of time, in milliseconds, the agent will wait before trying to resend a guaranteed command that previously failed

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.client.max-retries
c:simple-property.description: This is the maximum amount of times the agent will resend a guaranteed command that previously failed due to something other than a cannot-connect error

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.client.send-throttling
c:simple-property.description: Configures the send throttle. See the documentation for more information on send throttling

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.client.queue-throttling
c:simple-property.description: Configures the queue throttle. See the documentation for more information on queue throttling

c:group.name: startup
c:group.c:description: Configures what the agent does while it is starting up

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.register-with-server-at-startup
c:simple-property.displayName: Register with RHQ Server At Startup?
c:simple-property.description: This will force the agent to register with the RHQ Server, even if it is already registered

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.wait-for-server-at-startup-msecs
c:simple-property.displayName: Time To Wait For RHQ Server At Startup
c:simple-property.description: This is the number of milliseconds the agent will wait for the RHQ Server to come up

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.update-plugins-at-startup
c:simple-property.description: This will force the agent to download plugin updates from the RHQ Server

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.test-failover-list-at-startup
c:simple-property.description: If true, the agent will attempt to connect to all servers found in its failover list. Warning messages will be logged if errors occur while attempting to connect to one or more servers.

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.agent-update.enabled
c:simple-property.description: If true, the agent will be allowed to update itself if it finds there is a new agent update binary available. If this feature is not enabled, the agent will never be allowed to update itself.

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.agent-update.version-url
c:simple-property.description: If defined, this will be the URL the agent uses when it needs to retrieve information about the latest available agent update binary. If this is not defined, the agent will ask its server for the agent update binary version information.

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.agent-update.download-url
c:simple-property.description: If defined, this will be the URL the agent uses when it needs to download the latest available agent update binary. If this is not defined, the agent will download the agent update binary from its server.

c:group.name: misc
c:group.c:description: Settings that usually do not need to change under normal circumstances

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.data-directory
c:simple-property.description: Location where the agent can persist data to the file system

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.disable-native-system
c:simple-property.description: Disables the native system; agent will not use the native JNI libraries

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.primary-server-switchover-check-interval-msecs
c:simple-property.description: The amount of milliseconds in between checking that the agent is connected to the primary server, as opposed to a failover server. The check is disabled if this is 0.

c:simple-property.name: rhq.communications.remote-stream-max-idle-time-msecs
c:simple-property.description: The maximum amount of milliseconds an agent-hosted remote stream is allowed to remain idle before it will be closed.

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.client.command-spool-file.name
c:simple-property.description: Defines the name of the command spool file. This file must be located in the data directory (if one does not exist, it will be created)

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.client.command-spool-file.params
c:simple-property.description: Defines the maximum size the spool file is allowed to be and how it is to be purged. See the documentation on the format of this value.

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.client.command-spool-file.compressed
c:simple-property.description: If true, data in the spool file will be compressed. Note that this saves disk space at the expense of performance

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.vm-health-check.interval-msecs
c:simple-property.description: The amount of milliseconds in between checking the health of the agent's Java Virtual Machine. The check is disabled if this is set to 0.

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.vm-health-check.low-heap-mem-threshold
c:simple-property.displayName: VM Health Check Low Heap Memory Threshold
c:simple-property.description: The threshold percentage that must be crossed if the agent's VM health check is to consider the JVM with critically low memory. This value is a percentage of used heap memory out of the maximum heap size.

c:simple-property.name: rhq.agent.vm-health-check.low-nonheap-mem-threshold
c:simple-property.displayName: VM Health Check Low NonHeap Memory Threshold
c:simple-property.description: The threshold percentage that must be crossed if the agent's VM health check is to consider the JVM with critically low memory. This value is a percentage of used non-heap memory out of the maximum non-heap size.

operation.name: retrieveUniqueResourceClassLoaderInformation

c:simple-property.name: classloaderInfo

c:simple-property.name: resourceCount
c:simple-property.description: The number of resources that are currently assigned this resource classloader

c:simple-property.description: The full path to launcher script file

operation.name: Restart
operation.description: Restarts the agent VM. This will completely kill the agent VM process (if it is running as this service) and then attempt to restart it. If the agent executing this operation will quickly die, no confirmation will be available as to the success or failure of this operation.

operation.name: Stop
operation.description: Stops the agent VM gracefully. This will completely kill the agent VM process (if it is running as this service). If the agent executing this operation will quickly die, no confirmation will be available as to the success or failure of this operation.

operation.name: Kill
operation.description: Performs a hard kill on the agent VM. This will completely kill the agent VM process (if it is running as this service). If the agent executing this operation will quickly die, no confirmation will be available as to the success or failure of this operation.

operation.name: Status
operation.description: Gets the status of agent VM, if it was launched by the launcher script.

service.name: Java Service Wrapper Launcher
service.description: The Java Service Wrapper that can run the agent as a daemon service

c:simple-property.name: launcherScript
c:simple-property.description: The full path to wrapper launcher script file

c:simple-property.name: configurationFile
c:simple-property.description: The full path to the configuration file

c:simple-property.name: environmentFile
c:simple-property.description: The full path to the environment setup file

c:simple-property.name: includeFile
c:simple-property.description: The full path to the include file

operation.name: Install
operation.description: Installs the Java Service Wrapper so it starts the agent at boot time

operation.name: Restart
operation.description: Restarts the Java Service Wrapper and the agent it contains. This will completely kill the agent VM process (if it is running as this service) and then attempt to restart it. If the agent executing this operation will quickly die, no confirmation will be available as to the success or failure of this operation.

operation.name: Stop
operation.description: Stops the Java Service Wrapper and the agent it contains. This will completely kill the agent VM process (if it is running as this service). If the agent executing this operation will quickly die, no confirmation will be available as to the success or failure of this operation.

operation.name: Remove
operation.description: Removes the Java Service Wrapper so it no longer starts the agent at boot time. *NOTE* This will completely kill the agent VM process if it is running as this service. If the agent executing this operation will quickly die, no confirmation will be available as to the success or failure of this operation.

operation.name: Status
operation.description: Gets the status of the Java Service Wrapper

c:list-property.name: mainConfigurationSettings
c:list-property.description: The main JSW configuration. This is read-only - to customize the configuration, add settings to the environment and/or includes.

c:simple-property.name: name
c:simple-property.description: Name of the wrapper configuration setting

c:simple-property.name: value
c:simple-property.description: Value of the wrapper configuration setting

c:list-property.name: environmentSettings
c:list-property.description: Environment settings to further customize the JSW. These are set prior to applying the main configuration and include settings. Variables set here can be placed in the main config or includes using the %VAR% notation.

c:simple-property.name: name
c:simple-property.description: Name of the environment variable

c:simple-property.name: value
c:simple-property.description: Value of the environment variable

c:list-property.name: includeSettings
c:list-property.description: Override settings that augment the existing JSW configuration. These are applied after the main configuration is set.

c:simple-property.name: name
c:simple-property.description: Name of the wrapper override setting

c:simple-property.name: value
c:simple-property.description: Value of the wrapper override setting
